channel.title: Need a guide/help or someone to show over team viewer
channel.description: Already have it port forwarded and etc.. i just need to know how to make it so other people can see it. I also need the new code since jdk just had an update for the path and class variable and for the compile.

item.title: Need a guide/help or someone to show over team viewer
item.dc:creator: @callmedragon callmedragon
item.description:
@callmedragon wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:3, topic:408282”]Be sure that you put your no-ip in the client and stuff then release it change it back when you released it on the web. So for example:

if I made example.no-ip.biz, I would replace my 127.0.0.1 with my no-ip account. Then, I release it on mediafire and advertise it. As soon as I put it on mediafire I put 127.0.0.1 back and then advertise. But only put 127.0.0.1 for you, the no-ip should be for the rest of the people. Though you have the source and it will connect normally with 127.0.0.1.

TIP: Always leave your sources “run” command on and your no-ip client on. It helps the connection plus the source will be open so that will mean people can get on it.

TIP: Set your battery setting to not turn off if with charger if your close the lid. Your server can be all night and your battery will e charged for the morning :).[/quote]
Okay do you have teamviewer? So you could show me so i know it for future reference?

Read full topic
item.source: Need a guide/help or someone to show over team viewer

item.title: Need a guide/help or someone to show over team viewer
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Be sure that you put your no-ip in the client and stuff then release it change it back when you released it on the web. So for example:

if I made example.no-ip.biz, I would replace my 127.0.0.1 with my no-ip account. Then, I release it on mediafire and advertise it. As soon as I put it on mediafire I put 127.0.0.1 back and then advertise. But only put 127.0.0.1 for you, the no-ip should be for the rest of the people. Though you have the source and it will connect normally with 127.0.0.1.

TIP: Always leave your sources “run” command on and your no-ip client on. It helps the connection plus the source will be open so that will mean people can get on it.

TIP: Set your battery setting to not turn off if with charger if your close the lid. Your server can be all night and your battery will e charged for the morning :).

Read full topic
item.source: Need a guide/help or someone to show over team viewer

To ‘see it’ i’m just going to take it as how to advertise it, which I beleive would be here … Then for the compile for which ever Java version you have change the C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\javac.exe … to your Java Or something ideal to that.
